parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions Dumitrița Gliga, a deputy, and her father, Vasile Gliga, a former PSD leader.  It directly links them to the PSD party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post targeting a wide audience, not a private communication. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a broad dissemination intended.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While presented as a news article, the highly critical tone and focus on the family connections and alleged misuse of power within the PSD could negatively influence voters' perception of Dumitrița Gliga and the PSD. The objective seems to be to damage the reputation of the mentioned individuals and, by extension, the PSD.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post is formatted like a news article, including a link to a website. However, the highly critical and accusatory language, focusing on family connections and alleged corruption, goes beyond objective reporting and leans towards opinion and potentially biased reporting.  The lack of counterpoints or alternative perspectives weakens its journalistic integrity.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the article expresses strong opinions, it's presented as a news report, not a personal opinion piece. The accusatory nature and lack of neutrality suggest an intention beyond personal expression.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>912542110533708</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while formatted as a news article, exhibits characteristics of electoral propaganda. It directly names a parliamentary candidate (Dumitrița Gliga) and her father, linking them to the PSD party and presenting highly critical information about their alleged actions.  The accusatory tone and lack of neutrality suggest an intention to negatively influence voters' perception of the candidate and the party. The wide reach of the paid advertisement further strengthens this interpretation. While the post links to an article, the presentation on Facebook itself is designed to be impactful and concise, prioritizing the negative portrayal of the candidate and party.  The argument that it's simply journalism is weakened by the lack of objectivity and the clear negative impact it aims to have on the PSD.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Dumitrița Gliga</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Ziarul Tricolorul</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Ziarul Tricolorul, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 912542110533708), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu conținut electoral negativ ce vizează candidata Dumitrița Gliga și Partidul Social Democrat (PSD). Postarea, prezentată sub forma unui articol de știri, conține acuzații grave și lipsește de obiectivitate, având drept scop influențarea negativă a electoratului prin asocierea candidatei cu acțiuni reprobabile ale tatălui său, fost lider PSD.  Textul, difuzat printr-o campanie plătită pe Facebook cu o estimare a audienței de peste 1 milion de persoane și un buget de sub 100 RON,  folosește un limbaj acuzator și lipsit de neutralitate jurnalistică, depășind limitele activității jurnalistice de informare a publicului.  Efectul electoral este clar negativ pentru candidata Dumitrița Gliga și PSD, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului.  Informațiile prezentate, fără dovezi concrete și fără perspective contrare, constituie o formă de propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie.  Contact: asociatiakogaionon@gmail.com, +40744343554, adresa: strada migdalilor nr 61, Pantelimon, Ilfov 077145, RO.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
